means: [人名] [爱尔兰姓氏] 布拉肯盖尔语姓氏的英语形式，来源于人名，含义是“有斑点的”(speckled,spotted)
[地名] [加拿大、美国] 布拉肯

word_mean: 羊齿，欧洲蕨：水龙骨科(Polypodiaceae)的一种厥(Pｔeridium aquilinum Kuhn)，分布于全世界，在兽医学中记载为有毒植物。由于该蕨所含硫胺酶破坏硫胺，故可使单胃动物发生严重的中毒。在反刍动物，中毒显然是由于可渗析的小分子导致骨髓再生不良，可引起死亡

sentence.Network_en: The pool had dried up and was full of bracken and reeds.
sentence.Network_cn: 水塘已经干涸，里面都是欧洲蕨和芦苇。

sentence.Network_en: The bracken was turning to the dusky gold of a fine autumn.
sentence.Network_cn: 欧洲蕨在晴朗的秋天正变为暗金色.

sentence.Network_en: In most news reports the name Margot Bracken figured prominently.
sentence.Network_cn: 大部分新闻报导突出地提到马戈特·布雷肯的名字.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : of Scandinavian origin; related to Danish bregne, Swedish bräken

entry.def: Bracken is a large plant with leaves that are divided into many thin sections. It grows on hills and in woods.

means.word_mean: 1. fern of southeastern Asia; not hardy in cold temperate regions
2. large coarse fern often several feet high; essentially weed ferns; cosmopolitan
